posts.title: Searching for Art Resources from Home
posts.text: Are you looking for art resources from home and don’t know where to begin? Try using one of these six recommended resources accessible outside the Library with your NYPL card.

posts.title: Reader's Den: The Human Body by Paolo Giordano, Part 3
posts.text: If you are looking for another war novel to get you fired up about the battlefield or home front, or if you are itching to find a protagonist dealing with the trials and tribulations caused by the world around them, take a look at these suggested titles.

posts.title: Reader's Den: The Human Body by Paolo Giordano, Part 2
posts.text: I take my hat off to you for continuing this discussion of The Human Body on Reader's Den. See below some questions to consider for your reading.

posts.title: Reader's Den: The Human Body by Paolo Giordano
posts.text: Join us this month as we discuss the psychological impact of comradeship, family, and war taken on by a platoon of Italian soldiers based in Afghanistan.

posts.title: Travel: A Reading List from Open Book Night
posts.text: Books and destinations from around the world were discussed at the most recent Open Book Night, and lots of recommendations were picked up along the way.

posts.title: June Author @ the Library Programs at Mid-Manhattan
posts.text: Come  join us for an Author @ the Library talk this June at Mid-Manhattan Library to hear distinguished non-fiction authors discuss their work and answer your questions.

posts.title: Kitty Genovese: The Girl Next Door That Everyone Knew
posts.text: Maybe because Kitty Genovese's story conjures up questions of how crimes are committed, and the emotional struggles we live with from such events, this story hasn’t quite come to an end even after fifty years. We talked to the author of a new book about the famous murder.

posts.title: September Author @ the Library Programs at Mid-Manhattan
posts.text: Any of these subjects pique your curiosity? If so,  join us for an Author @ the Library talk this September at Mid-Manhattan Library to hear distinguished non-fiction authors discuss their work and answer your questions. Author talks take place at 6:30 p.m. on the 6th floor of the Library, unless otherwise noted. You can also request the authors' books using the links to the catalog included below.
